result.execSummary:
The defendant Ahmed Farah Hirsi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ahmed Farah Hirsi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Ahmed Farah Hirsi was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ahmed Farah Hirsi is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Ahmed Farah Hirsi was found guilty of 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Ahmed Farah Hirsi was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Peterson June 29, 2018 - Court vacates and dismisses Counts 10, 11 and 12.

-Concurrent to Counts 5 and 6 but consecutive to Counts 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15 and 16.

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Counts 5 and 6 but consecutive to Counts 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15 and 16

Modified all assessments (except for Atty fees and Witness fee) to zero per plea on 4/23/21. Sentencing hearing was set on 8/26/21 and costs/restitution were addressed at sentencing. sf

02:35 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Cole Daniel Ruby and Aaron Nelson, DF: Ahmed Farah Hirsi appeared from jail, Agent Volz appeared. Court reviews file. PSI filed. Stipulation will be filed regarding jail credit. DA Anderson requests to reopen and vacate sentence 15CF295 and re-sentence. Atty. Nelson does not object. Court notes there is no notice for today of anything in 15CF295 and will not proceed with any issues on that file. DA Anderson notes possible error in PSI. Agent Volz makes verbal correction to PSI. Atty. Nelson does not note any additional discrepencies to PSI. Court notes dismissed counts 1, 5, 6, 8, 9, 13, 14 and 15 to be read in for purposes of sentencing and restitution. Sentencing arguments. Atty. Nelson believes jail credit totals 2775 days; State has 10 days to object. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 4:14 PM. kma

CO: Peterson  REP: Kasten CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Megan E. Kelly and DA Mike Nieskes. Student Intern Halle Hatch   DF ATTY:  Cole Daniel Ruby and Albert Goins DF:  Ahmed Farah Hirsi #00632922 appeared from jail. Case called at 8:32 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a motion hearing. Does not believe an evidentiary hearing is needed in all 7 motions. Atty Goins states the only testimony would like to hear is from Maryann Hurshe. Unable to serve subpeona. Would like to offer police reports as an offer of proof. DA Nieskes responds. Does not object as an offer of proof. Court will receive the police report as an offer of proof in lieu of testimony for todays purposes. Atty Ruby makes statement. Requesting a short continuance to try and bring Ms. Hurshe in. Court will schedule a new date after the conclusion of today's matter. Court will note the State's objection. DA Nieskes requesting deadlines for service be set of July 31st. No objection by the defense. Court addresses Motions. Roman Numeral I. Court orders Ct's 10, 11 & 12 will be vacated and dismissed. Atty Ruby gives argument on the State's failure to disclose terms of agreement to Defense and Jury. Requesting the proffer letter be admitted as part of the record. State does not object.Court will Order proffer letter dated 7/15/2014 pages 2-3 filed by defense will be received and made part of record. Atty Ruby responds. ADA Kelly gives argument. Roman Numberal III regarding the Other Acts Evidence and the aquittal in the MN matter. Court has already made decision. Atty Goins gives argument on Other Acts Evidence. DA Nieskes responds. Court gives reasoning on allowing that evidence in. Atty Goins responds. Atty Ruby makes statement. Brief response by DA Nieskes. Roman Numeral IV regarding the identification of DE was improper and V regarding Detective Henry's Testimony. Atty Goins gives argument. Atty Ruby responds. ADA Kelly gives objection. Response by Atty Goins. Court requesting authority regarding the identification issue. Atty Goins to submit in writing. Atty Goins gives extended argument on V. ADA Kelly responds. Atty Ruby gives argument. DA Nieskes gives argument. Atty Goins responds. Roman Numeral VI regarding burden shifting. Atty Ruby gives argument. ADA Kelly responds. Roman Numeral VII. DA Nieskes regarding this be reserved since in envolves Maryann Hurshe. No objection by Atty Goins. Parties speak regarding further scheduling. Atty Goins requesting 30 days to issue the subpeona after the receipt of the courtdate. OFF RECORD at 10:08 a.m. Case recalled at 10:16 a.m. Court will continue this matter to 08-13-2018. Court will be prepared to give an Oral Ruling that day. If witness is not available that day, matter will continue without. State will prepare the transport order. Court adjourns at 10:18 a.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 13, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Back on the record 9:17 a.m. ADA Nieskes references the amended information and last names of witnesses misspelled. Asking for an oral amendment to Count 4 and Count 15. ADA Nieskes makes statement.  Asking  the court to acknowledge to stipulate the defendant can not carry a firearm due to a felony conviction. Defendant does not object. State's Exhibit #35(printed copy of scaled drawing). Exhibit #35, ADA Nieskes asking to be O/R and published by the jury. No objection by the defendant. Court O/R Exhibit #35. Court O/R Exhibit #1 and permission to publish to the jury by showing DVD. Court receives states Exhibits #14,#15 and #16. Published to jury through dvd. Envelope that contains bullet. Labeled as State's Exhibit #39 (inside evidence labeled Item #1 collected by Hudson PD). CO: James Peterson, REP: Cory Crandall, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes and ADA Matthew Hartung .  Christopher Stephen Petros standby Attorney.  DF:  Ahmed Farah Hirsi appeared from jail. Case called at 2:11 p.m. Court will address Mr. Hirsi's Motion in Limine. ADA Nieskes has no objection to Motion 1 and 2. Court will grant Mr. Hirsi's Motions #1 and #2. State has filed an amended information. Agree and object to Motion #3 allowing prior convictions. Mr. Hirsi does not object. Defendant has copy of amended information. Has read Ct #16. Waives reading. Enters NG plea on Ct #16. Court will enter the NG plea on Ct #16 and will not require another preliminary hearing on that. Court will hand out proposed jury instructions and do a separate party to the crime instruction along with substantive instructions. Court rules on Motion #3. Only if defendant testifies on prior criminal record may be impeached upon by the state. ADA Nieskes states prior criminal history has been given to counsel. Will take up as need be. Motion #4. State objects due to wording. Would like to present the St. Paul record. Not argue the outcome of the matter. Will play video and ask persons to identify defendant. Defendant makes argument. Should not bring in facts from St Paul case for jury to hear on this case. ADA Nieskes gives argument and states proper to let St. Paul case in. Asking court to deny that motion. Court states is not bound by anything in MN. Requirements that there is a foundation, the jury would be able to see the video and up to the jury to decide on the witnesses testimony. Will take that up upon course of trial. Court will not make a ruling and reserve on Motion #4. Will take up per witness. ADA Nieskes states Wednesday will be calling in the witnesses. ADA Nieskes the video and persons that would be able to identify defendant will be evidence. Addresses Motions #5 and #6. Will be part of states arguments. Objects to both these motions. Court if adequate foundation is made is brought up, state may bring up argument. Court will take notice during trial of defendant's objections. State brings up Motion #7,#8 and #9 regarding sequestration, the sequestration rule will be followed. Court grants #7,#8 and #9 is granted. An officer will be present in the courtroom and will be instructed not to discuss with witnesses. They will be instructed during Vor Dire. State regarding courtroom appearance, no issue on what he is wearing. Court states he may wear what he would like to wear. Just look presentable for the jury. State addresses motion to question jurors, objects to this motion. Mr. Hirsi gives argument. ADA Nieskes gives argument. Court will allow defendant to send questions through Atty Petros and court will address at that time. Court will not prejudice in anyway. Up to Monday morning, may submit any more questions he may have. State brings up issue where witnesses may identify defendant, issue has already been brought up and ruled upon. Court agrees and follows previous ruling and adequate foundation needs to be made. Defendant objecting to using a copy of videos instead of original videos. Court will take up later and reserve if state decides to introduce more videos. ADA Nieskes brings up witnesses and defendant has the list. May not call of of them listed but wants them on list in case state decides to call on them. Court states that scheduled times do not need to be provided when a witness will be called and will not order to do so. Court goes through flow of the jury trial. State proposes their schedule. Ready for testimony on Monday at 1 p.m. Atty Petros requesting the state to provide which witnesses will be called on which date. Court requesting state to provide courtesy to defendant on tentative timeline. State goes through and reviews defendant's proposed Voir Dire.Will leave to discretion of the court. Court will give defendant copies of the jury questionnaires at the beginning of Voir Dire and will be collected at the end. Will not be able to keep notes on jurors. Court will direct biases of jurors during Voir Dire. Court goes over States Motions in Limine with defendant. Defendant objects to Motion #5. Court explains procedures that will follow with the witnesses. Decisions will be made before witnesses testify. Follow standard rule. Atty Petros states that defendant's family did hire a private investigator to look into witnesses. Defendant objects to Motion #11. Court explains Motion #11. Can be addressed during arguments to the court and the court makes the ruling. Defendant objects to Motion #17. Gives argument. ADA Hartung gives argument and asks court to grant states motion. Court states evidence limited for identity purposes only from the St Paul case. Court will grant Motion #17. Limited to facts of evidence offered and will not get into outcome of that trial. Jury will get instructions on this matter at the beginning of the trial. Court recesses at 3:26 p.m. Case recalled at 3:50 p.m. Court has provided Mr. Hirsi, counsel for the state and reserve counsel copies of the safety plan. Defendant does have objections. Court goes over safety concerns. Voir Dire, opening statements and closing arguments shackles will be removed and a belt will be placed on him if he is cooperative. ADA Nieskes makes comments regarding placement of the tables during trial. Defendant is in agreement with state's recommendation.  State will review the jury instructions and state has nothing further. Atty Petros states that one of the witnesses may have more information to provide. ADA Nieskes sent an officer to gather more information. Does not have all the details yet. State will provide any further information received to Atty Petros and defendant when it is obtained. ADA Nieskes makes statement regarding defendant ability to conduct his own defense. Withdrawing request. Defendant wishes to continue to exercise his right to represent himself and to have standby counsel. Court has signed an Order regarding media orders and copies will be provided. Not set in stone, standard Order and can be modified. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 4:16 p.m.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Mohamed Desalla Hussein, Fausi Ibnahim Mohamed, Samaira Xamira, Mohamud Abdulah Mohamed, Fartun Ibrahim Aidid, Guled Bile Abdi and Abdirahman Abdiriazak Hersi.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
